title: Breast of chicken and spinach with tarragon mushroom sauce Makes 4 servings This recipe is ideal for a dinner party because most of the preparation can be done in advance. Serve with brown rice or pasta.
directions: In saucepan, heat oil over medium heat.
Add mushrooms and onion; cook, stirring occasionally, until tender and most of the liquid is evaporated.
Sprinkle with flour and tarragon; cook, stirring, for 2 minutes.
Bring broth to boil; gradually pour into mushroom mixture, whisking constantly. Cook, whisking constantly, until boiling and thickened slightly.
Simmer, uncovered, for 10 minutes or until reduced to about 375 mL (1 1⁄2 cups)
On plate, combine flour, thyme, salt, and pepper to taste.
In shallow bowl, combine egg and water.
On another plate, combine bread crumbs and cheese. Coat chicken pieces with seasoned flour; shake off excess.
Dip into egg mixture, then roll in crumb mixture. Set aside.
Trim stems from spinach. Wash and shake off water; place in saucepan with just the water clinging to leaves.
Cover and cook over medium-high heat until wilted. Drain thoroughly; squeeze out excess liquid and chop coarsely.
Toss spinach with lemon juice, oil, and salt and pepper.

On lightly greased baking sheet or in microwaveable dish, bake chicken in 200°C (400°F) oven for 15 minutes, or microwave, loosely covered with waxed paper, on High for 5 to 6 minutes, or until chicken is no longer pink inside.
If microwaving, let stand for 1 to 2 minutes (cooking time will vary, depending on thickness of chicken).
Place chicken on top of spinach. Garnish with a few spoonfuls of tarragon and mushroom sauce.

Make ahead: Cook spinach a few hours in advance; reheat in microwave or on stove, then add lemon juice, oil, and salt and pepper. Refrigerate prepared unbaked chicken for 20 minutes or for up to 2 hours. Tarragon mushroom sauce can be covered and refrigerated for up to 2 days.
ingredients: 5 mL (1 tsp) canola or olive oil
1 mL (1⁄4 tsp) or less salt and freshly ground pepper
